II. Purpose of Addendum
Change of the terms of the Boelkins program from male only to male and female.
III. Methodology
On 2/24/2021 I reviewed an updated program statement provided by the Chief
Administrator.
On 2/26/2021 I held a conference call with the Chief Administrator to discuss the
proposed changes to the program including preparation of program staff for the
change, additional supervision concerns, and bedroom arrangements.
On 3/25/2021 I received and reviewed an application for the proposed change.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
The Boelkins program has historically served male youth. Expanding the terms to
include female youth would allow the program to accept additional placement
referrals. Wedgwood already has 2 co-ed programs on campus, so there is no
need to change the policies and procedures in place. The Boelkins home has two
separate hallways with youth bedrooms allowing for separation of genders. Each
hallway has a single stall bathroom, which includes a shower. The bathrooms are
locked from the outside requiring staff to open the bathroom for youth’s use. The
program has recently undergone staffing changes and there will be a new program
supervisor hired and all program staff will be trained regarding the change in the
milieu. There are no programming changes needed.
V. Recommendation
I recommend that the terms of the Kentwood Campus license be changed to
include female youth for the Boelkins program only.
